Statement: Improving the quality of people’s skills so that they are able to make use of more natural resources is also a human made resource
The discovery of fire led to the practice of cooking and other processes while the invention of the wheel ultimately resulted in development of newer modes of transport
Time and technology are two important factors that can change substances into resources
Non-renewable resources are those which have a limited stock
Shortage and drying up of natural water sources is a major problem in many parts of the world today
Utility or usability is what makes an object or substance a resource
Renewable resources are those which are used quickly.
Natural resources can be broadly categorised into renewable and hazardous resources.
The technology to create hydroelectricity has turned energy in oil and water into an important resource
Improving the quality of people’s skills so that they are able to create more resources is known as natural resource enhancement.
